name: Zarif Azher
short_description: Undergraduate student at Caltech studying Bioengineering and Computer Science. Experienced innovator and researcher with 10+ peer-reviewed publications in leading journals and conferences. Passionate about applying technology to biomedical problems to expand global healthcare access.
long_description:
Zarif Azher is an undergraduate student at Caltech pursuing a Bachelor of Science in Bioengineering and Computer Science (2024-2028). He is a passionate innovator and researcher with extensive experience applying computational methods to biomedical challenges. Zarif has published over 10 peer-reviewed papers in leading journals and conferences, with research focusing on computational pathology, spatial transcriptomics, and AI applications in healthcare.

His professional experience includes working as a Medical Technology Innovator at the National Institute of Cardiovascular Diseases (May 2022-Dec 2024), AI Engineer at Caire Health (Jun 2024-Oct 2024), and Director of the Government Accountability Project at Dhaka North City Corporation (Jan 2023-Sep 2024). He has also held research positions at Case Western Reserve University as a Computational Pathology Researcher (May 2022-Aug 2023) and internships at The World Bank (May-Aug 2023), University of Maryland (Jun 2021-Dec 2022), and Bangladesh University (Apr 2020-Sep 2024).

Zarif's research publications span diverse areas including spatial omics, cancer pathology analysis, molecular assessments of skin photoaging, and environmental justice. His work demonstrates a strong interdisciplinary approach combining bioinformatics, artificial intelligence, and pathology. He is committed to leveraging powerful technology to solve biomedical problems with the goal of expanding global healthcare access.
